00050 typedef __PACKED_H struct
00051 {
00052   u8 modifier;
00053   u8 reserved;
00054   u8 keycode[6];
00055 } __PACKED_F KeyboardReport_TypeDef;

00064 /* Private constants ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00065 #define CLASS_DESC_OFFSET                   (18)
00066 
00067 #define CLASS_REQ_01_GET_RPOT               (u16)(0x1 << 8)
00068 #define CLASS_REQ_02_GET_IDLE               (u16)(0x2 << 8)
00069 #define CLASS_REQ_03_GET_PTCO               (u16)(0x3 << 8)
00070 #define CLASS_REQ_09_SET_RPOT               (u16)(0x9 << 8)
00071 #define CLASS_REQ_0A_SET_IDLE               (u16)(0xA << 8)
00072 #define CLASS_REQ_0B_SET_PTCO               (u16)(0xB << 8)
00073 
00074 #define HID_RPOT_TYPE_01_INPUT              (0x01)
00075 #define HID_RPOT_TYPE_02_OUTPUT             (0x02)
00076 #define HID_RPOT_TYPE_03_FEATURE            (0x03)
00077 
00078 #define HID_LED_1_MASK      (0x1)
00079 #define HID_LED_2_MASK      (0x2)
00080 #define HID_LED_3_MASK      (0x4)
00081 #define HID_LED_1_BIT       (0)
00082 #define HID_LED_2_BIT       (1)
00083 #define HID_LED_3_BIT       (2)
00084 
00085 #define CLASS_REQ_20_SET_LINE_CODING        (0x20)
00086 #define CLASS_REQ_21_GET_LINE_CODING        (0x21)
00087 #define CLASS_REQ_22_SET_CONTROL_LINE_STATE (0x22)
00088 
00089 #define CDC_INF_NUM                         (11)
00090 #define CDC_EPT_IN_LENGTH                   (_EP2LEN)
00091 #define CDC_EPT                             (USBD_EPT2)
00092 
00093 #define BUF_SIZE                            (512) //Don't set just enough buffers.

00135 /* USB HID Report Descriptor                                                                                */
00136 __ALIGN4 static uc8 USB_HID_ReportDesc[] = {
00137     0x05, 0x01,                    // USAGE_PAGE (Generic Desktop)
00138     0x09, 0x06,                    // USAGE (Keyboard)
00139     0xa1, 0x01,                    // COLLECTION (Application)
00140 
00141     0x05, 0x07,                    //   USAGE_PAGE (Keyboard)
00142     0x19, 0xe0,                    //   USAGE_MINIMUM (Keyboard LeftControl)
00143     0x29, 0xe7,                    //   USAGE_MAXIMUM (Keyboard Right GUI)
00144     0x15, 0x00,                    //   LOGICAL_MINIMUM (0)
00145     0x25, 0x01,                    //   LOGICAL_MAXIMUM (1)
00146     0x75, 0x01,                    //   REPORT_SIZE (1)
00147     0x95, 0x08,                    //   REPORT_COUNT (8)
00148     0x81, 0x02,                    //   INPUT (Data, Var, Abs)
00149 
00150     0x95, 0x01,                    //   REPORT_COUNT (1)
00151     0x75, 0x08,                    //   REPORT_SIZE (8)
00152     0x81, 0x03,                    //   INPUT (Cnst, Var, Abs)
00153 
00154     0x95, 0x03,                    //   REPORT_COUNT (3)
00155     0x75, 0x01,                    //   REPORT_SIZE (1)
00156     0x05, 0x08,                    //   USAGE_PAGE (LEDs)
00157     0x19, 0x01,                    //   USAGE_MINIMUM (Num Lock)
00158     0x29, 0x03,                    //   USAGE_MAXIMUM (Kana)
00159     0x91, 0x02,                    //   OUTPUT (Data, Var, Abs)
00160 
00161     0x95, 0x01,                    //   REPORT_COUNT (1)
00162     0x75, 0x05,                    //   REPORT_SIZE (5)
00163     0x91, 0x03,                    //   OUTPUT (Cnst, Var, Abs)
00164 
00165     0x95, 0x06,                    //   REPORT_COUNT (6)
00166     0x75, 0x08,                    //   REPORT_SIZE (8)
00167     0x15, 0x00,                    //   LOGICAL_MINIMUM (0)
00168     0x25, 0x65,                    //   LOGICAL_MAXIMUM (101)
00169     0x05, 0x07,                    //   USAGE_PAGE (Keyboard)
00170     0x19, 0x00,                    //   USAGE_MINIMUM (Reserved (no event indicated))
00171     0x29, 0x65,                    //   USAGE_MAXIMUM (Keyboard Application)
00172     0x81, 0x00,                    //   INPUT (Data, Ary, Abs)
00173 
00174     0xc0                           // END_COLLECTION
00175 };
00176 
00177 static u32 gOutputReportBuffer;
00178 __ALIGN4 static u8 gInputReportBuffer[64];
00179 static vu32 gIsSetOutputReport = FALSE;
00180 static vu32 gIsEP1INEmpty = TRUE;
00181 __ALIGN4 static KeyboardReport_TypeDef gKeyboardReport;
00182 static u32 gIsKeySent = FALSE;
00183 
00184 static u32 uIsTerminalOpened = 0; // 2: Terminal is opened
00185 static u32 gCDCEPOUTLen = 0;
00186 static vu32 gIsCDCEPINEmpty = TRUE;
00187 static u32 gIsZLP_Require = FALSE;
00188 static USBDClass_VCP_LINE_CODING USBDClassVCPLineCoding;
00189 
00190 __ALIGN4 static u8 gWelcomMessage[64] = {
00191   "Holtek HT32 Virtual COM Test\r\n\r\nPress key to test loopback\r\n\r\n"
00192 };
00193 __ALIGN4 static u8 gInputDataBuffer[64];
00194 __ALIGN4 static u8 gOutputDataBuffer[64];
00195 __ALIGN4 static u8 gRingDataBuffer[BUF_SIZE];
00196 static u32 gIsDataReady = FALSE;
00197 static u32 gBufferIndex = 0;
00198 static Buffer_TypeDef gRingBuffer;

00200 /* Global Function -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00201 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00202   * @brief  USB Class initialization.
00203   * @param  pClass: pointer of USBDCore_Class_TypeDef
00204   * @retval None
00205   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00206 void USBDClass_Init(USBDCore_Class_TypeDef *pClass)
00207 {
00208   s32 i;
00209   Buffer_Init(&gRingBuffer, gRingDataBuffer, BUF_SIZE);
00210 
00211   pClass->CallBack_MainRoutine.func = USBDClass_MainRoutine;
00212   //pClass->CallBack_MainRoutine.uPara = (u32)NULL;
00213 
00214   pClass->CallBack_Reset.func = USBDClass_Reset;
00215   //pClass->CallBack_Reset.uPara = (u32)NULL;
00216 
00217   //pClass->CallBack_StartOfFrame.func = USBDClass_StartOfFrame;
00218   //pClass->CallBack_StartOfFrame.uPara = (u32)NULL;
00219 
00220   pClass->CallBack_ClassGetDescriptor = USBDClass_Standard_GetDescriptor;
00221   //pClass->CallBack_ClassSetInterface = USBDClass_Standard_SetInterface;
00222   //pClass->CallBack_ClassGetInterface = USBDClass_Standard_GetInterface;
00223 
00224   pClass->CallBack_ClassRequest = USBDClass_Request;
00225   pClass->CallBack_EPTn[1] = USBDClass_Endpoint1;
00226   pClass->CallBack_EPTn[2] = USBDClass_Endpoint2;
00227   pClass->CallBack_EPTn[3] = USBDClass_Endpoint3;
00228   pClass->CallBack_EPTn[4] = USBDClass_Endpoint4;
00229   //pClass->CallBack_EPTn[5] = USBDClass_Endpoint5;
00230   //pClass->CallBack_EPTn[6] = USBDClass_Endpoint6;
00231   //pClass->CallBack_EPTn[7] = USBDClass_Endpoint7;
00232 
00233   #ifdef RETARGET_IS_USB
00234   pClass->CallBack_EPTn[RETARGET_RX_EPT] = SERIAL_USBDClass_RXHandler;
00235   #endif
00236 
00237   gKeyboardReport.modifier = 0;
00238   for (i = 5; i >=0; i--)
00239   {
00240     gKeyboardReport.keycode[i] = 0;
00241   }
00242 
00243   return;
00244 }
00245 
00246 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00247   * @brief  USB Class CDC send data.
00248   * @param  pFrom: Source buffer
00249   * @param  len: Length for write IN data
00250   * @retval Total length written by this function
00251   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00252 s32 USBDClass_CDC_Tx(u32 *pFrom, u32 len)
00253 {
00254   /* Demo how to send data by Virtual COM IN endpoint                                                       */
00255   /* !!! For the Bulk endpoint, the data length must be N - 1 or N with ZLP (Zero Length Package).          */
00256   /* Where N is the max length of endpoint.                                                                 */
00257   if (gIsCDCEPINEmpty == TRUE)
00258   {
00259     gIsCDCEPINEmpty = FALSE;
00260     USBDCore_EPTWriteINData(CDC_EPT, (u32 *)pFrom, len);
00261     if (len == CDC_EPT_IN_LENGTH)
00262     {
00263       if (Buffer_isEmpty(&gRingBuffer) == TRUE)
00264       {
00265         gIsZLP_Require = TRUE; // Data Length = Endpoint maximum Length, need ZLP.
00266       }
00267     }
00268     return len;
00269   }
00270   else
00271   {
00272     return -1;
00273   }
00274 }
00275 
00276 /* Private functions ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00277 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00278   * @brief  USB Class main routine.
00279   * @param  uPara: Parameter for Class main routine
00280   * @retval None
00281   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00282 static void USBDClass_MainRoutine(u32 uPara)
00283 {
00284   USBDClass_ReportProcess();
00285   USBDClass_EPT1INProcess();
00286 
00287   /* Demo how to send data after terminal opened                                                            */
00288   if (uIsTerminalOpened == 2)
00289   {
00290     if (USBDClass_CDC_Tx((u32 *)gWelcomMessage, 64) == 64)
00291     {
00292       uIsTerminalOpened = 3;
00293     }
00294   }
00295 
00296   USBDClass_CDC_ZLPProcess();
00297   USBDClass_CDC_Rx();
00298 
00299   return;
00300 }
00301 
00302 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00303   * @brief  USB Class Report Process for application.
00304   * @retval None
00305   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00306 static void USBDClass_ReportProcess(void)
00307 {
00308   if (gIsSetOutputReport == TRUE)
00309   {
00310     gIsSetOutputReport = FALSE;
00311     (gOutputReportBuffer & HID_LED_1_MASK) ? HT32F_DVB_LEDOn(HT_LED1) : HT32F_DVB_LEDOff(HT_LED1);
00312     (gOutputReportBuffer & HID_LED_2_MASK) ? HT32F_DVB_LEDOn(HT_LED2) : HT32F_DVB_LEDOff(HT_LED2);
00313     (gOutputReportBuffer & HID_LED_3_MASK) ? HT32F_DVB_LEDOn(HT_LED3) : HT32F_DVB_LEDOff(HT_LED3);
00314   }
00315 
00316   return;
00317 }
00318 
00319 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00320   * @brief  USB Class CDC ZLP Process for application.
00321   * @retval None
00322   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00323 static void USBDClass_CDC_ZLPProcess(void)
00324 {
00325   u32 *nullptr = 0;
00326   if (gIsZLP_Require == TRUE && gIsCDCEPINEmpty == TRUE)
00327   {
00328     gIsZLP_Require = FALSE;
00329     gIsCDCEPINEmpty = FALSE;
00330     USBDCore_EPTWriteINData(CDC_EPT, (u32 *)nullptr, 0);
00331   }
00332 
00333   return;
00334 }
00335 
00336 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00337   * @brief  USB Class Endpoint 1 IN Process for application.
00338   * @retval None
00339   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00340 static void USBDClass_EPT1INProcess(void)
00341 {
00342   s32 i = 0;
00343 
00344   for (i = 5; i >=0; i--)
00345   {
00346     gKeyboardReport.keycode[i] = 0;
00347   }
00348 
00349   i = 0;
00350   if (gKeyStatus[HID_KEY_NUMLOCK])
00351   {
00352     gKeyStatus[HID_KEY_NUMLOCK] = 0;
00353     gKeyboardReport.keycode[i++] = 0x53;
00354   }
00355 
00356   if (gKeyStatus[HID_KEY_CAPSLOCK])
00357   {
00358     gKeyStatus[HID_KEY_CAPSLOCK] = 0;
00359     gKeyboardReport.keycode[i++] = 0x39;
00360   }
00361 
00362   if (gKeyStatus[HID_KEY_SCROLLLOCK])
00363   {
00364     gKeyStatus[HID_KEY_SCROLLLOCK] = 0;
00365     gKeyboardReport.keycode[i++] = 0x47;
00366   }
00367 
00368   if (i != 0 && gIsEP1INEmpty == TRUE)
00369   {
00370     gIsEP1INEmpty = FALSE;
00371     USBDCore_EPTWriteINData(USBD_EPT1, (u32 *)&gKeyboardReport, sizeof(gKeyboardReport));
00372     gIsKeySent = TRUE;
00373   }
00374   else if (i == 0 && gIsKeySent == TRUE && gIsEP1INEmpty == TRUE)
00375   {
00376     gIsEP1INEmpty = FALSE;
00377     USBDCore_EPTWriteINData(USBD_EPT1, (u32 *)&gKeyboardReport, sizeof(gKeyboardReport));
00378     gIsKeySent = FALSE;
00379   }
00380 
00381   return;
00382 }
00383 
00384 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00385   * @brief  USB Class CDC Rx Process.
00386   * @retval None
00387   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00388 static void USBDClass_CDC_Rx(void)
00389 {
00390   /* Demo how to check Virtual COM RingBuffer data is empty or not                                          */
00391   if (Buffer_isEmpty(&gRingBuffer) == FALSE)
00392   {
00393     // !!! Add your data process here
00394 
00395     gBufferIndex = Buffer_GetLength(&gRingBuffer);
00396     if (gBufferIndex > 64)
00397     {
00398       gBufferIndex = 64;
00399     }
00400     gIsDataReady = TRUE;
00401   }
00402 
00403   /* Loop Back data to the Tx                                                                               */
00404   #if 1
00405   if (gIsDataReady == TRUE && gIsCDCEPINEmpty == TRUE)
00406   {
00407     Buffer_Read(&gRingBuffer, gInputDataBuffer, gBufferIndex);
00408     if (USBDClass_CDC_Tx((u32 *)gInputDataBuffer, gBufferIndex) == gBufferIndex)
00409     {
00410       gIsDataReady = FALSE;
00411     }
00412   }
00413   #endif
00414 
00415   return;
00416 }
00417 
00418 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00419   * @brief  USB Class Reset.
00420   * @param  uPara: Parameter for Class Reset.
00421   * @retval None
00422   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00423 static void USBDClass_Reset(u32 uPara)
00424 {
00425   gIsEP1INEmpty = TRUE;
00426   gIsKeySent = FALSE;
00427 
00428   uIsTerminalOpened = 0;
00429   gIsCDCEPINEmpty = TRUE;
00430   gIsZLP_Require = FALSE;
00431 
00432   gIsDataReady = FALSE;
00433 }
00434

00447 #endif

00449 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00450   * @brief  USB Device Class Request
00451   * @param  pDev: pointer of USB Device
00452   * @retval None
00453   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00454 static void USBDClass_Request(USBDCore_Device_TypeDef *pDev)
00455 {
00456   u16 uUSBCmd = *((u16 *)(&(pDev->Request)));
00457   u32 inf = pDev->Request.wIndex;
00458 
00459 #ifdef RETARGET_IS_USB
00460   SERIAL_USBDClass_Request(pDev);
00461 #endif
00462 
00463   if (inf == CDC_INF_NUM)
00464   {
00465     u8 USBCmd2 = *((u8 *)(&(pDev->Request.bRequest)));
00466     u16 len = *((u16 *)(&(pDev->Request.wLength)));
00467     switch (USBCmd2)
00468     {
00469       case CLASS_REQ_22_SET_CONTROL_LINE_STATE:
00470       {
00471         if (len == 0)
00472         {
00473           USBDClass_SetControlLineState(pDev);
00474         }
00475         break;
00476       }
00477       case CLASS_REQ_20_SET_LINE_CODING:
00478       {
00479         USBDClass_SetLineCoding(pDev);
00480         break;
00481       }
00482       case CLASS_REQ_21_GET_LINE_CODING:
00483       {
00484         USBDClass_GetLineCoding(pDev);
00485         break;
00486       }
00487       // others not support
00488       default:
00489       {
00490         break;
00491       }
00492     }
00493   }
00494 
00495   switch (uUSBCmd)
00496   {
00497     /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00498     /* | bRequest             | Data transfer direction | Type                | Recipient   | Data          */
00499     /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00500 
00501     /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00502     /* | 01_Get Report        | 80_Device-to-Host       | 20_Class Request    | 1_Interface | 01A1h         */
00503     /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00504     case (CLASS_REQ_01_GET_RPOT | REQ_DIR_01_D2H | REQ_TYPE_01_CLS | REQ_REC_01_INF):
00505     {
00506       __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld GET RPOT\t[%02d][%02d]\r\n", __DBG_USBCount, pDev->Request.wValueH, pDev->Request.wLength);
00507       USBDClass_GetReport(pDev);
00508       break;
00509     }
00510     /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00511     /* | 02_Get Idle          | 80_Device-to-Host       | 20_Class Request    | 1_Interface | 02A1h         */
00512     /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00513     case (CLASS_REQ_02_GET_IDLE | REQ_DIR_01_D2H | REQ_TYPE_01_CLS | REQ_REC_01_INF):
00514     {
00515       __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld GET IDLE\r\n", __DBG_USBCount);
00516       USBDClass_GetIdle(pDev);
00517       break;
00518     }
00519     /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00520     /* | 03_Get Protocol      | 80_Device-to-Host       | 20_Class Request    | 1_Interface | 03A1h         */
00521     /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00522     case (CLASS_REQ_03_GET_PTCO | REQ_DIR_01_D2H | REQ_TYPE_01_CLS | REQ_REC_01_INF):
00523     {
00524       __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld GET PTCO\r\n", __DBG_USBCount);
00525       USBDClass_GetProtocol(pDev);
00526       break;
00527     }
00528     /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00529     /* | 09_Set Report        | 00_Host-to-Device       | 20_Class Request    | 1_Interface | 0921h         */
00530     /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00531     case (CLASS_REQ_09_SET_RPOT | REQ_DIR_00_H2D | REQ_TYPE_01_CLS | REQ_REC_01_INF):
00532     {
00533       __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld SET RPOT\t[%02d][%02d]\r\n", __DBG_USBCount, pDev->Request.wValueH, pDev->Request.wLength);
00534       USBDClass_SetReport(pDev);
00535       break;
00536     }
00537     /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00538     /* | 0A_Set Idle          | 00_Host-to-Device       | 20_Class Request    | 1_Interface | 0A21h         */
00539     /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00540     case (CLASS_REQ_0A_SET_IDLE | REQ_DIR_00_H2D | REQ_TYPE_01_CLS | REQ_REC_01_INF):
00541     {
00542       __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld SET IDLE\r\n", __DBG_USBCount);
00543       USBDClass_SetIdle(pDev);
00544       break;
00545     }
00546     /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00547     /* | 0B_Set Protocol      | 00_Host-to-Device       | 20_Class Request    | 1_Interface | 0B21h         */
00548     /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00549     case (CLASS_REQ_0B_SET_PTCO | REQ_DIR_00_H2D | REQ_TYPE_01_CLS | REQ_REC_01_INF):
00550     {
00551       __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld SET PTCO\r\n", __DBG_USBCount);
00552       USBDClass_SetProtocol(pDev);
00553       break;
00554     }
00555   }
00556 
00557   return;
00558 }
00559 
00560 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00561   * @brief  USB Device Class Request - Set Line Coding
00562   * @param  pDev: pointer of USB Device
00563   * @retval None
00564   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00565 static void USBDClass_SetLineCoding(USBDCore_Device_TypeDef *pDev)
00566 {
00567   pDev->Transfer.pData = (uc8*)&USBDClassVCPLineCoding;
00568   pDev->Transfer.sByteLength = (sizeof(USBDClassVCPLineCoding) > pDev->Request.wLength) ? (pDev->Request.wLength) : (sizeof(USBDClassVCPLineCoding));
00569   pDev->Transfer.Action = USB_ACTION_DATAOUT;
00570   return;
00571 }
00572 
00573 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00574   * @brief  USB Device Class Request - Get Line Coding
00575   * @param  pDev: pointer of USB Device
00576   * @retval None
00577   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00578 static void USBDClass_GetLineCoding(USBDCore_Device_TypeDef *pDev)
00579 {
00580   if (uIsTerminalOpened == 1)
00581   {
00582     uIsTerminalOpened = 2;
00583   }
00584 
00585   pDev->Transfer.pData = (uc8*)&USBDClassVCPLineCoding;
00586   pDev->Transfer.sByteLength = (sizeof(USBDClassVCPLineCoding) > pDev->Request.wLength) ? (pDev->Request.wLength) : (sizeof(USBDClassVCPLineCoding));
00587   pDev->Transfer.Action = USB_ACTION_DATAIN;
00588   return;
00589 }
00590 
00591 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00592   * @brief  USB Device Class Request - Set Control Line State
00593   * @param  pDev: pointer of USB Device
00594   * @retval None
00595   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00596 static void USBDClass_SetControlLineState(USBDCore_Device_TypeDef *pDev)
00597 {
00598   if (pDev->Request.wValueL & 0x1)
00599   {
00600     uIsTerminalOpened = 1;
00601   }
00602   else
00603   {
00604     uIsTerminalOpened = 0;
00605   }
00606 
00607   pDev->Transfer.pData = 0;
00608   pDev->Transfer.sByteLength = 0;
00609   pDev->Transfer.Action = USB_ACTION_DATAOUT;
00610 
00611   return;
00612 }
00613 
00614 
00615 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00616   * @brief  USB Device Class Standard Request - GET_DESCRIPTOR
00617   * @param  pDev: pointer of USB Device
00618   * @retval None
00619   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00620 static void USBDClass_Standard_GetDescriptor(USBDCore_Device_TypeDef *pDev)
00621 {
00622   u32 type = pDev->Request.wValueH;
00623 
00624   switch (type)
00625   {
00626     case DESC_TYPE_21_HID:
00627     {
00628       pDev->Transfer.pData = (uc8 *)((pDev->Desc.pConfnDesc) + CLASS_DESC_OFFSET);
00629       pDev->Transfer.sByteLength = DESC_LEN_HID;
00630       pDev->Transfer.Action = USB_ACTION_DATAIN;
00631       break;
00632     }
00633     case DESC_TYPE_22_RPOT:
00634     {
00635       pDev->Transfer.pData = (uc8 *)(USB_HID_ReportDesc);
00636       pDev->Transfer.sByteLength = DESC_LEN_RPOT;
00637       pDev->Transfer.Action = USB_ACTION_DATAIN;
00638       break;
00639     }
00640     case DESC_TYPE_23_PHY:
00641     {
00642       break;
00643     }
00644   } /* switch (type)                                                                                        */
00645 
00646   return;
00647 }
00648

00675 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00676   * @brief  USB Device Class Request - GET_REPORT
00677   * @param  pDev: pointer of USB Device
00678   * @retval None
00679   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00680 static void USBDClass_GetReport(USBDCore_Device_TypeDef *pDev)
00681 {
00682   u32 value = pDev->Request.wValueH;
00683   u32 len = pDev->Request.wLength;
00684 
00685   switch (value)
00686   {
00687     case HID_RPOT_TYPE_01_INPUT:
00688     {
00689       pDev->Transfer.pData = (uc8 *)&(gInputReportBuffer);
00690       pDev->Transfer.sByteLength = len;
00691       pDev->Transfer.Action= USB_ACTION_DATAIN;
00692       break;
00693     }
00694     case HID_RPOT_TYPE_03_FEATURE:
00695     {
00696       break;
00697     }
00698   }
00699 
00700   return;
00701 }

00711      For example....

00715

00717   pDev->Transfer.sByteLength = 1;
00718   pDev->Transfer.Action= USB_ACTION_DATAIN;
00719 
00720   */
00721   return;
00722 }

00744 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00745   * @brief  USB Device Class Request - SET_REPORT
00746   * @param  pDev: pointer of USB Device
00747   * @retval None
00748   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00749 static void USBDClass_SetReport(USBDCore_Device_TypeDef *pDev)
00750 {
00751   u32 value = pDev->Request.wValueH;
00752   u32 len = pDev->Request.wLength;
00753   switch (value)
00754   {
00755     case HID_RPOT_TYPE_02_OUTPUT:
00756     {
00757       pDev->Transfer.pData = (uc8 *)&(gOutputReportBuffer); // Buffer at least 4 bytes
00758       pDev->Transfer.sByteLength = len;
00759       pDev->Transfer.Action= USB_ACTION_DATAOUT;
00760       pDev->Transfer.CallBack_OUT.func = USBDClass_SetReportCallBack;
00761       pDev->Transfer.CallBack_OUT.uPara = len;
00762       break;
00763     }
00764     case HID_RPOT_TYPE_03_FEATURE:
00765     {
00766       break;
00767     }
00768   }
00769 
00770   return;
00771 }
00772 
00773 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00774   * @brief  USB Device Class Request - SET_IDLE
00775   * @param  pDev: pointer of USB Device
00776   * @retval None
00777   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00778 static void USBDClass_SetIdle(USBDCore_Device_TypeDef *pDev)
00779 {
00780   /* Add your own SET_IDLE function here....
00781      For example....
00782 
00783   u32 uReportID     = pDev->Request.wValueL;
00784   u32 uIdleDuration = pDev->Request.wValueH;
00785   u32 uInterface    = pDev->Request.wIndex;
00786 
00787   __IDLE_DURATION_BUFFER[uReportID] = uIdleDuration;
00788 
00789   */
00790   return;
00791 }
00792 
00793 /*********************************************************************************************************//**

00795   * @param  pDev: pointer of USB Device
00796   * @retval None
00797   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00798 static void USBDClass_SetProtocol(USBDCore_Device_TypeDef *pDev)
00799 {
00800   /* Add your own SET_PROTOCOL function here....
00801      For example....
00802 
00803   u32 uInterface = pDev->Request.wIndex;
00804   u32 uProtocol  = pDev->Request.wValueL;
00805 
00806   __PROTOCOL_BUFFER = uProtocol;
00807 
00808   */
00809   return;
00810 }
00811

00817 static void USBDClass_SetReportCallBack(u32 uPara)
00818 {
00819   gIsSetOutputReport = TRUE;
00820 
00821   return;
00822 }

00824 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00825   * @brief  USB Class Endpoint handler
00826   * @param  EPTn: USB Endpoint number
00827   *         @arg USBD_EPT0 ~ USBD_EPT7
00828   * @retval None
00829   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00830 static void USBDClass_Endpoint1(USBD_EPTn_Enum EPTn)
00831 {
00832   gIsEP1INEmpty = TRUE;
00833 
00834   __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld EP1IN\t[%02d]\r\n", ++__DBG_USBCount, (int)USBDCore_EPTGetBufferLen(EPTn));
00835   __DBG_USBDump((uc8 *)gInputReportBuffer, USBDCore_EPTGetBufferLen(EPTn));
00836 
00837   return;
00838 }
00839

00860   return;
00861 }
00862 
00863 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00864   * @brief  USB Class Endpoint handler
00865   * @param  EPTn: USB Endpoint number
00866   *         @arg USBD_EPT0 ~ USBD_EPT7
00867   * @retval None
00868   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00869 static void USBDClass_Endpoint4(USBD_EPTn_Enum EPTn)
00870 {
00871   /* Read Receive data.                                                                                     */
00872   gCDCEPOUTLen = USBDCore_EPTReadOUTData(EPTn, (u32 *)gOutputDataBuffer, 64);
00873 
00874   /* Move Receive data to Ring Buffer.                                                                      */
00875   if (Buffer_Write(&gRingBuffer, gOutputDataBuffer, gCDCEPOUTLen) != gCDCEPOUTLen)
00876   {
00877   /* Ring Buffer Overflow.                                                                                  */
00878     while(1);
00879   }
00880 
00881   __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld CDC OUT\t[%02d]", ++__DBG_USBCount, (int)gCDCEPOUTLen);
00882   __DBG_USBDump((uc8 *)gOutputDataBuffer, gCDCEPOUTLen);
00883 
00884   return;
00885 }
